info.title: optiSLang Web Service REST API
info.description:
The REST API allows you to manage instances of optiSlang Web Service. 
    Most of the provided API endpoints focus on the following:
    
    **Users** 
    - Register new or remove existing users.  
    - Change user level or password of existing users.
    
    **Projects**  
    - Retrieve registered project data 
    - get details about an existing project  
    - register an externally started project
    
    **Wizards**
    - Retrieve existing wizards or upload a new wizard.
    
    Additionally, there is functionality to execute Python scripts and manage custom services.

post.summary: Set a new password for user.

name.description: User who will have their password changed

post.summary: Create a new project working directory.
post.description: Working directory is created relative to configured projects directory. The provided base_name is used to create a unique directory name.

base_name.description: Base name for unique working directory path

relative_location.description: Actual path of the created working directory, relative to defined project base directory

post.summary: Discover currently running optiSLang projects within local network.

get.summary: Download an optiSLang Web App Wizard .

parameters.name: wizard_id
parameters.description: ID of the wizard to download.

get.summary: Download registered result files for a project. Zipped if more than one.

parameters.name: file_paths
parameters.description: List of result file paths to download. Format: file_paths[0]=/path/to/file_1&...&file_paths[n]=/path/to/file_n.

get.summary: Get defined actions.

include_state_info.description: Determines if detailed state info is to be included

post.summary: Get certain state of certain actor.

location.description: Actual location of project file on disc

machine.description: Name of machine the project has been registered/started on originally

server_address.description: Host ip the project is currently running on

server_port.description: Host port the project is currently running on

lock_info_msg.description: Lock info message if project is currently locked

get.summary: Get version.
Get name of currently logged in user.

message.description: Name of currently logged in user

post.summary: Get user settings for the visualization interface.

get.summary: Get ui settings.

parent_origin.description: Parent window URI if used in embedded mode. Omit this setting to disable embedded mode

text_file_extensions.description: List of file extensions that are to be handled as text files for result files preview

force_forward_to_monitoring.description: Force forwarding to project monitoring after project start from App Wizards

post.summary: Get project permissions for current user.

status.description: Determines if user has status view permission for this project

interaction.description: Determines if user has interaction permission for this project

get.summary: Get owned and accessible non-owned projects based on session user name.

allow_delete.description: Allow deletion of project. Will be false as long as optiSLang project is up and running

location.description: Actual location of project file on disc

machine.description: Name of machine the project has been registered/started on originally

wizard.description: Name of wizard that has been used to start the project

post.summary: Get project information for a specific project.

allow_delete.description: Allow deletion of project. Will be false as long as optiSLang project is up and running

location.description: Actual location of project file on disc

machine.description: Name of machine the project has been registered/started on originally

wizard.description: Name of wizard that has been used to start the project

post.summary: Get submission target list defined in wizard.
Get registered result files for a specific actor.

is_available.description: Determines if currently available for download

post.summary: Get registered result files for a project.

is_available.description: Determines if currently available for download

post.summary: Get registered result files for a project. This endpoint is deprecated, it will be removed in a future version. Use /get_project_result_files for project result files or /get_actor_result_files for actor result files.

is_available.description: Determines if currently available for download

post.summary: Get defined additional user permissions for a project.

get.summary: Get registered users.
get.description: Get registered users. The returned object contains user names as item IDs and additional information as item values. Schema is an example.

post.summary: Get the wizard ID used to start the project. Return an empty string if the project was not started via wizard.

get.summary: Get wizard groups.
get.description: Wizard groups are used to group wizards to organize them better. There are predefined (admin-defined) wizard groups and user-defined wizard groups.

some_admin_wizard_group_name.description: Wizards belonging to this wizard group

some_user_wizard_group_name.description: Wizards belonging to this wizard group

get.summary: Get wizard user groups.
get.description: Wizard user groups can used to restrict wizards to certain user group(s).

some_wizard_name.description: User groups defined for this wizard

get.summary: Get accessible AppWizards based on session user name.

post.summary: Query if provided user is admin user.

message.description: Determines if user is admin user

get.summary: Query if optiSLang system monitoring omdb file is available.

post.summary: Lock project or refresh an allready acquired lock.

get.summary: Combined login / get login form request.
get.description: Redirecting to "/" if already logged in. Otherwise, try to login if username and password parameters are defined, else get login form.

get.summary: Start custom login attempt if configured as such.
get.description: Redirecting to "/" if already logged in. Otherwise, get custom login form if enabled server side, else redirect to "/login"".

post.summary: Login using external (via frontend) authorization if allowed server side.
post.description: Redirect to "/login" if not allowed server side or no username specified. Redirecting to "/" if already logged in. Otherwise, login unconstrained using specified user name. Attention: This is unsafe as no server side credential check is performed! Functionality is disabled by default.

parameters.name: is_admin
parameters.description: Determines if user is admin user

get.summary: Logout currently logged in user.
Display optiSLang project monitoring by project ID.
get.description: Display optiSLang project monitoring by project ID.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: ID of the project monitoring to display

parameters.name: no_toolbar
parameters.description: Set to true to hide navigation toolbar

get.summary: Download optiSLang system monitoring omdb file.

project_id.description: Project ID to perform the action on

post.summary: Upload file. Can be an optiSLang project, an optiSLang Web App Wizard or an arbitrary project reference file. This endpoint is deprecated, it will be removed in a future version. Use /upload.
Execute a Wizard Python script on the backend side.
post.description: Only pre-installed wizard python scripts can be executed. Actual script path is computed server side using configured wizards base directory and provided wizard name and script file name.

wizard_name.description: Name of the wizard which provides the script

get.summary: Register user.
get.description: Create user account. Redirecting to "/login" if successfull.

parameters.name: password_confirm
parameters.description: Confirmation of the password used to register

machine.description: Host name of machine the optiSLang project has been started on

location.description: Location of the optiSLang project file

address.description: Host address of machine the optiSLang project has been started on. IP address lookup is used using the machine name in case address is not provided.

wizard.description: Name of wizard that has been used to start the project

post.description: Can only be performed by admin users.

post.summary: Perform command(s) at optiSLang project server.

some_admin_wizard_group_name.description: Wizards belonging to this wizard group

post.summary: Register result files with a project.

some_user_wizard_group_name.description: Wizards belonging to this wizard group

post.summary: Set additional user permissions for a project.

post.description: Wizard user groups can used to restrict wizards to certain user group(s). Can only set by admin users.

user_groups.description: User groups defined for this wizard

get.summary: First time admin setup.
get.description: Create admin account. Perform needed setup steps. Redirecting to "/login" if successfull.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The admin username used to register

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The admin password used to register

parameters.name: password_confirm
parameters.description: Confirmation of the admin password used to register

post.description: Can only be performed by admin users.

post.summary: Start an optiSLang project to run locally on the backend.

location.description: Location of the optiSLang project file relative to configured projects directory.

project_name.description: Optional project name. File base name is used by default.

post.summary: Use a Wizard Python script for a customized optiSLang start.
post.description: Only pre-installed wizard python scripts can be used. Actual script path is computed server side using configured wizards base directory and provided wizard name and script file name.

wizard_name.description: Name of the wizard which provides the script

project_name.description: Optional project name. Project file base name is used by default.

post.description: This endpoint is deprected and has no functionality anymore.

post.summary: Upload file. Can be either an optiSLang project, an optiSLang Web App Wizard or an arbitrary project reference file.

osl_project_file.description: When uploading an optiSLang project file, a new working directory is created within the projects directory. The project file is then uploaded into this working directory. The actual path to the uploaded project file is contained in the reponse.

wizard.description: When uploading an optiSLang Web App Wizard, the App Wizard files are uploaded into wizards directory. The directory name corresponds to the uploaded App Wizard file name. The ID and the url path to the uploaded App Wizard is contained in the reponse.

file.description: This variant is intended for uploading project reference/input files. Files can only be uploaded into a specific project working directory. Either a project id or a specific project working directory can be specified. When specifying a project id, the working directory entry is optional and needs to be specified relative to the project working directory. Files will never be overwritten.

working_dir.description: The directory to upload the file to. Can be specified absolutely or relative to the projects directory. When specified along with project_id it is treated relative to the project working directory.

project_id.description: The id of the project to upload an reference/input file to.

oneOf.description: This response is returned when using the osl_project_file or file variants

location.description: The filesystem location of the uploaded project or project reference/input file

oneOf.description: This response is returned when using the wizard variant

id.description: The filesystem location of the uploaded project or project reference/input file

get.summary: Display a wizard by ID.

parameters.name: wizard_id
parameters.description: ID of the wizard to display

parameters.name: no_toolbar
parameters.description: Set to true to hide navigation toolbar
